abstracts.cdata!:
The Klaipeda Port Entrance
            Rehabilitation project will construct new breakwaters,
            rehabilitated existing breakwaters, and deepen and widen the
            port entrance channel. Expected environmental impacts,
            especially during the construction phase, will affect water
            quality, aquatic life, fisheries, navigation and port
            operations, urban land traffic, and recreation. Positive
            effects of the project include a reduction in the risk of
            oil spills and prevention of further coastal erosion by the
            addition of dredged sand on beaches. Mitigation measures
            include: creation of an automated database system concerning
            sediment types and locations; guarding against the
            introduction of alien species; protection of fish migration
            routes and spawning areas; separate dredging of clean and
            contaminated sediments; confined disposal of contaminated
            sediments; offshore disposal of uncontaminated dredged
            sediments; beach or foreshore replacement; planning of
            navigation and road transport during construction work;
            informing the public; and creation of a cleanup plan for
            pollution caused by construction activities.
